sentences.english: No freedom without sacrifice, endless blood perpetuated convictions of our national dignity. (UTOYXC)
sentences.chinese: 爲自由而流的血，鑄成永垂不朽的民族尊嚴。
忘了電子郵件永垂不朽。

sentences.english: People have dreamt of immortality since time immemorial .
sentences.chinese: 人們自古以來就夢想着永垂不朽。

sentences.english: It is just a lot of blah blah filling the emptiness of the people perpetuating it.
sentences.chinese: 連篇的廢話充斥於人們使信息永垂不朽的空洞之中。

sentences.english: Youth will break, but memory lasts forever.
sentences.chinese: 青春終將散場，唯獨記憶永垂不朽。

sentences.english: They loved life and wanted it to go on forever.
sentences.chinese: 他們熱愛生命，希望生命能永垂不朽。

sentences.english: These men shared more than just a birthday, the loss of a mother in childhood and a date with immortality.
sentences.chinese: 他們兩個同一天出生，都幼年喪母，而且都永垂不朽。

sentences.english: They make us believe immortality exists.
sentences.chinese: 他們讓我們相信永垂不朽。

sentences.english: Sharing your knowledge to others is a way to achieve immortality.
sentences.chinese: 和他人分享知識，是永垂不朽的途徑之一。

sentences.english: Men rise and fall like the winter wheat…but these names will never die .
sentences.chinese: 人的生命有如冬麥般起落，但這些名字將永垂不朽。

sentences.english: How did it feel to be immortalized in song?
sentences.chinese: 在歌曲中永垂不朽的感覺如何？

sentences.english: Share your knowledge. It's a way to achieve immortality .
sentences.chinese: 與別人分享你的知識是永垂不朽的途徑之一。

sentences.english: Nothing is immortal, such as love.
sentences.chinese: 沒有什麼會永垂不朽，比如愛。

definition: lit. although dead, as if still alive (idiom); still with us in spirit
(of one's name, reputation etc) to be immortalized (idiom)/to leave a mark for generations to come
large inscribed stele/fig. great achievement/imperishable masterpiece
lit. you can sing or you can cry (idiom); fig. deeply moving/happy and sad/inspiring and tragic
to commemorate/to recall fondly/to think of the past
